title: [Large-Scale] Social Worker Ethics and Social Media Utilization Simulation

context.prior_knowledge: Knowledge of Basic Social Welfare Theory and Basic Experience Using Social Media
context.additional_context: Asynchronous collaboration and simulation-based practical training environments using closed digital platforms

learning_goals: Identify three or more ethical dilemmas that can occur in social media environments
Apply an ethical decision-making process when using social media in the role of a social worker through VR simulation
Design social media utilization guidelines from an international perspective through asynchronous collaboration

Graduate students complete a 5-page report and 10-minute presentation within four weeks for each of three ethical dilemma cases (data bias, algorithmic fairness, personal information protection) presented in a project-based assessment. They apply a five-step problem-solving framework (problem definition → cause analysis → alternative generation → implementation plan → evaluation metrics) and achieve an ‘excellent’ grade in four or more of five rubric items, including clear justification for each step, feasibility assessment of alternatives, and measurability of evaluation metrics.
difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
